messageBody:
> I have a problem with java.beans.XMLEncoder that only occurs
> when my test is run in the swing GUI JUnit and not when I run
> through ant.
>
> My XMLEncoder test runs fine when I run it via ant. But when
> I run it using the swing gui (running from within idea) it
> comes up with the stack overflow error below. Normally my
> tests run fine in both ways.

Hello Morten,

I'm afraid I'm not too familiar with this problem, however, I do have
the feeling that I have read about this before. I searched the archives
of this list, and Google, but to no avail (granted I haven't tried too
hard).

Here is what is tickling my brain:
I have the feeling that this is a classloader issue, as is typical
with the JUnit Swing GUI. You didn't mention: whether it worked using
the AWT and Text Runners; nor which version of JUnit you are using.

However, in line with what I say above, there are two potential
problems/solutions:
- the first is more of a solution than a problem, and has to do with the
excluded.properties file. Check that an entry for the XmlEncoder
package is in/out, and try adding/removing the entry. It may create
more problems than it solves, but its worth a try.

- the second is more a problem than a solution: check that you do not
include 2 versions of the XML libraries in the classpath. This
sometimes causes the Swing GUI to get its knickers in a twist.

Try these out, and report back if successful.

Manuel Amago.
